column1: Why couldnt the candle get any sleep? theres no rest for the wicked.
column3: Wicked can mean evil or morally bad (first meaning), and it can also refer to the act of being unable to rest (slang usage meaning cool or awesome).
column4: The wicked witch was defeated by the brave hero.
column5: The party was wicked, and everyone had a great time.

column1: What has 100 legs and sixteen teeth? The front row of a Willie Nelson concert.
column3: Teeth refers to the chompers in an organisms mouth (first meaning), and in this joke, it humorously suggests the gaps or spaces where teeth should be.
column4: The dentist said I need to brush my teeth at least twice a day.
column5: The crowds teeth were displayed prominently in laughter as they enjoyed the show.

column1: What do you call it when a prisoner takes his own mugshot? a cellfie.
column3: Cell refers to a small room for a prisoner (first meaning), and it can also mean a small unit of a cell phone (slang usage regarding mobile devices).
column4: The prisoner was locked in his cell for the night.
column5: I need to check my cell for missed calls.
